ValueDomain.preferredName: Medical History Dictionary Derived Term Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Name
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A medical history identifier obtained from a dictionary._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: A medical history identifier obtained from a dictionary.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Data Element Medical History Event Dictionary-Derived/Standardized Term does not have Preferred Question Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Data Element Medical History Event Dictionary-Derived/Standardized Term does not have Preferred Question Text

ReferenceDocuments.name: MHDECOD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: This is typically not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CTEP Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: What is the neoplasm histologic type name?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CTEP Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: What [is/was] the invasive component of the breast?
